title: Area of a Triangle
summary: Find the area of a triangle using base and height.
whenToUse: Use for gables, triangular roof sections, or bracing layouts.
steps: Confirm base and height are perpendicular.
Divide by two to get the area.
commonMistakes: Using the sloping side instead of the perpendicular height.
siteTips: Mark a right angle to confirm the height measurement.
Use a story pole for consistent heights on repeatable triangles.
verification: Area should be about half the rectangle with same base and height.
